cssQuestions.Que: What does CSS stand for?
cssQuestions.Ans: Cascading Style Sheets

cssQuestions.Que: Explain Box Model in CSS?
cssQuestions.Ans:
The CSS box model is essentially a box that wraps around every HTML element. It consists of: margins, borders, padding, and the actual content.
Content- The content of the box, where text and images appears.
padding-Clears an area around the content. The padding is transparent.
border-A border that goes around the padding and content.
margin-Clears an area outside the border. The margin is transparent.

cssQuestions.Que: Is border or outline is the part of box model?
cssQuestions.Ans: Border

cssQuestions.Que: Explain different positions in CSS?
cssQuestions.Ans:
Static, Relative, Absolute, Fixed
1. Static- Default value. An element with position: static; is not positioned in any special way; it is always positioned according to the normal flow of the page.
2. Relative- An element with position: relative; is positioned relative to its normal position.
3. Absolute- An element with position: absolute; is positioned relative to the nearest positioned ancestor (instead of positioned relative to the viewport, like fixed).
4. Fixed- An element with position: fixed; is positioned relative to the viewport, which means it always stays in the same place even if the page is scrolled.
5. Sticky- An element with position: sticky; is positioned based on the user's scroll position.

cssQuestions.Que: Differnece between inline and block level elements?
cssQuestions.Ans: Inline elements do not start on a new line and only take up as much width as necessary. Block level elements start on a new line and take up the full width available.

cssQuestions.Que: Difference between absolute and relative positioning?
cssQuestions.Ans: Relative positioning moves an element in relation to where it would have been. Absolute positioning moves an element in relation to its parent.

cssQuestions.Que: Difference between Fixed and sticky positioning?
cssQuestions.Ans: Fixed positioning is relative to the viewport. Sticky positioning is relative to the user's scroll position.

cssQuestions.Que: How do you hide an element in CSS?
cssQuestions.Ans: visibility: hidden; and display: none;

cssQuestions.Que: Difference between visibility: hidden; and display: none;?
cssQuestions.Ans: visibility: hidden; hides the element, but it still takes up space. display: none; hides the element and does not take up any space.

cssQuestions.Que: Difference between inline, block and inline-block?
cssQuestions.Ans: Inline elements do not start on a new line and only take up as much width as necessary. Block level elements start on a new line and take up the full width available. Inline-block elements are similar to inline elements, but they can have a width and height.

cssQuestions.Que: What are pseduo classes in CSS and pseudo elements?
What are the different type of selectors in CSS?
cssQuestions.Ans: ID Selector, Class Selector, Universal Selector, Grouping Selector

cssQuestions.Que: What is specificity in CSS?
cssQuestions.Ans: Specificity is the means by which browsers decide which CSS property values are the most relevant to an element and, therefore, will be applied.

cssQuestions.Que: How to calculate specificity in CSS?
cssQuestions.Ans: Inline styles have the highest specificity, followed by IDs, classes, and elements. If two selectors have the same specificity, the last one will take precedence.

cssQuestions.Que: What are sprites images? What is the benifit of using it in CSS?
cssQuestions.Ans: Sprites are a collection of images put into a single image. It reduces the number of server requests and saves bandwidth.

cssQuestions.Que: Tell me some property of Grid and Flexbox in CSS?
cssQuestions.Ans: Grid: grid-template-columns, grid-template-rows, grid-column-gap, grid-row-gap, grid-gap, grid-template-areas, justify-items, align-items, justify-content, align-content, justify-self, align-self. Flexbox: flex-direction, flex-wrap, flex-flow, justify-content, align-items, align-content, order, flex-grow, flex-shrink, flex-basis, flex.

cssQuestions.Que: How to do responsive web design with CSS?
cssQuestions.Ans: Media queries, viewport, fluid grids, flexible images, and media.

cssQuestions.Que: What are the different media breakpints for different devices?
What is the difference between CSS and SCSS?
cssQuestions.Ans: SCSS is a preprocessor that allows for more functionality in CSS like variables, nesting, and mixins.

cssQuestions.Que: What is the difference between CSS and SASS?
cssQuestions.Ans: SASS is a preprocessor that allows for more functionality in CSS like variables, nesting, and mixins.

cssQuestions.Que: What are the new features in CSS3?
cssQuestions.Ans: New selectors, rounded corners, shadows, text effects, animations, transitions, gradients, multiple columns, border images, and more.

cssQuestions.Que: What is the difference between CSS and CSS3?
cssQuestions.Ans: CSS3 is the latest version of CSS.

cssQuestions.Que: Difference between ':last-child' and ':last-of-type' in CSS?
cssQuestions.Ans: last-child selects the last child element of its parent. last-of-type selects the last element of a specific type.

cssQuestions.Que: What is BEM methodology in CSS?
cssQuestions.Ans: Block Element Modifier is a methodology that helps you to create reusable components and code sharing in front-end development.

cssQuestions.Que: What is the diffecence between 'px', 'em' and 'rem' in CSS?
cssQuestions.Ans: px is a fixed unit of measurement. em is a relative unit of measurement. rem is a relative unit of measurement, but it is relative to the root element.
